texts.orig: on our Linux systems, but  it went end-of-life in 2022 :
texts.text: on our Linux systems, but  it went end-of-life in 2022 :

texts.orig:
NOTE: This software is now End-Of-Life. 4.4.3 is the final release
planned. We will continue to keep the public issue tracker and user
mailing list open.

You should read this file carefully before trying to install or use
the ISC DHCP Distribution.
texts.text:
NOTE: This software is now End-Of-Life. 4.4.3 is the final release
planned. We will continue to keep the public issue tracker and user
mailing list open.

You should read this file carefully before trying to install or use
the ISC DHCP Distribution.

texts.text: along with cloud-init for the initial dhcp request during the first part of cloud-init's work. I set off to switch Fedora's cloud-init package to

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: What's new with dhcpcd?
texts.text: What's new with dhcpcd?

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: There are some nice things about
texts.text: There are some nice things about

texts.label: code
texts.orig: dhcpcd
texts.text: dhcpcd

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: that you can find in the  GitHub repository :
texts.text: that you can find in the  GitHub repository :

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Very small footprint with almost no dependencies on Fedora
texts.text: Very small footprint with almost no dependencies on Fedora

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: It can do DHCP and DHCPv6
texts.text: It can do DHCP and DHCPv6

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: It can also be a
texts.text: It can also be a

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The project had its last release back in December 2023 and had commits as recently as this week.
texts.text: The project had its last release back in December 2023 and had commits as recently as this week.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: But I use NetworkManager
texts.text: But I use NetworkManager

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That's great! A switch from
texts.text: That's great! A switch from

texts.label: code
texts.orig: dhclient
texts.text: dhclient

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: to
texts.text: to

texts.label: code
texts.orig: dhcpcd
texts.text: dhcpcd

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: for cloud-init won't affect you.
texts.text: for cloud-init won't affect you.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: When cloud-init starts, it does an initial dhcp request to get just enough networking to reach the cloud's metadata service. This service provides all kinds of information for cloud-init, including network setup instructions and initial scripts to run.
texts.text: When cloud-init starts, it does an initial dhcp request to get just enough networking to reach the cloud's metadata service. This service provides all kinds of information for cloud-init, including network setup instructions and initial scripts to run.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: NetworkManager doesn't start taking action until cloud-init has written the network configuration to the system.
texts.text: NetworkManager doesn't start taking action until cloud-init has written the network configuration to the system.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: But I use systemd-networkd
texts.text: But I use systemd-networkd

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Same as with NetworkManager, this change applies to the  very  early boot and you won't notice a different when deploying new cloud systems.
texts.text: Same as with NetworkManager, this change applies to the  very  early boot and you won't notice a different when deploying new cloud systems.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: How can I get it right now?
texts.text: How can I get it right now?

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you're using a recent build of Fedora rawhide (the unstable release under development), you likely have it right now on your cloud instance. Just run
texts.text: If you're using a recent build of Fedora rawhide (the unstable release under development), you likely have it right now on your cloud instance. Just run

texts.label: code
texts.orig: journalctl --boot
texts.text: journalctl --boot

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: , search for
texts.text: , search for

texts.label: code
texts.orig: dhcpcd
texts.text: dhcpcd

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: There's also an  update pending for Fedora 40 , but it's currently held up by the beta freeze. That should appear as an update as soon as Fedora 40 is released.
texts.text: There's also an  update pending for Fedora 40 , but it's currently held up by the beta freeze. That should appear as an update as soon as Fedora 40 is released.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Keep in mind that if you have a system deployed already, cloud-init won't need to run again. Updating to Fedora 40 will update your cloud-init and pull in
texts.text: Keep in mind that if you have a system deployed already, cloud-init won't need to run again. Updating to Fedora 40 will update your cloud-init and pull in

texts.label: code
texts.orig: dhcpcd
texts.text: dhcpcd

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: , but it won't need to run again since your configuration is already set.
texts.text: , but it won't need to run again since your configuration is already set.
